answers.answer: Have you been test for any other diseases?  Thirst could be indicative of diabetes.Also, if you're possibly mouth breathing at night, it could also be causing some dry mouth.  Any nasal problems?

question: Hi again,Just want to let you know that I awake several times per night due to extreme thirst.  This is not a seasonal thing as this has been going on for 8/9 months.  Been to several dentists and one perio (2 weeks after cleaning) He thought my teeth were dirty and still recommends every 3 months for cleaning.  One had his hygenist paint on a desensitizing gel----but it did not work as it would not adhere to the teeth.  the surfaces of the teeth are pitted and angled like a dremel was used on them.  Thank you for any sugestions you may have.Sue
title: Dental Pain
